= Select and Append Item =
* `d3.selectl("ul").append("li").text("List Item")`
* `d3.selectAll("li").text("List Items")`

= Attach data to DOM element, Inline CSS,  =
{{{
    <body>
        <ul></ul>
        <script>
        const dataset = ["a", "b", "c"];
        d3.select("ul").selectAll("li")
          .data(dataset)                        // Reviews the dataset and runs the following code 3 times, one for each item of the array
          .enter().append("li")                 // enter() method sees if there is enough li element else creates new nodes for incoming data
          .text((item) => item);                // text() takes callback where the argument reference each item of the dataset
          .style("font-family", "verdana")      // inline CSS
        </script>
    </body>

}}}

= Change style based on data =
* `selection.style("color", (d) => d<20 ? 'red' : 'green')`

= Set attribute =
* `selection.attr("class", "container")`
* Now we can write normal css referencing this class attribute.
